title: `--single-target` option builds for multiple targets in some situations
body:
### What happened?

When using a partial build by specifying the `--single-target` argument for the build command, there are cases where it may build for more than one target.

### How can we reproduce this?

When you specify an architecture that is a prefix of another architecture, it will also build for that target. (e.g. arm and arm64, mips and mipsle...)
Here is an example configuration to reproduce the issue:
```yaml
version: 2
builds:
  - id: linux_arm64
    env:
      - CGO_ENABLED=1
      - CC=aarch64-linux-gnu-gcc
    ldflags:
      - -s -w
      - -extldflags "-static -fpic"
    flags:
      - -trimpath
    goos:
      - linux
    goarch:
      - arm64
    main: ./cmd/example
    binary: example-{{ .Os }}-{{ .Arch }}
  - id: linux_arm
    env:
      - CGO_ENABLED=1
      - CC=arm-linux-gnueabihf-gcc
    ldflags:
      - -s -w
      - -extldflags "-static -fpic"
    flags:
      - -trimpath
    goos:
      - linux
    goarch:
      - arm
    goarm:
      - 7
    main: ./cmd/example
    binary: example-{{ .Os }}-{{ .Arch }}
```
Run the build command `GOOS=linux GOARCH=arm goreleaser build --single-target --clean`, and you will see that arm64 is included in the build.
